result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M Baier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew M Baier is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew M Baier was found guilty of Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid to DOC - Half Rest. to be paid w/in 60 dys ($643.50 by Nov. 23rd) the other half w/in 120 days - balance due in January
Defendant shall be gainfully employed or seeking work.

Defendant shall not possess firearms; Defendant shall manitain sobriety; Defendant shall not consume alcohol or illegal drugs; Defendant shall not be on premises where primary business is serving alcohol; Defendant shall not have contact with co-defendants; Defendant shall not have contact with Torch's Bar or victims; Defendant is not eligible to vote.
Defendant shall provide DNA sample; Defendant shall complete any and all evaluations recommended by probation and follow through as directed; Defendant shall complete an apology letter.

timeConds.notes: W/Huber/Domestic/Report by 5PM 9/25/15.  Defendant can serve in Waushara County jail if no cost to Dunn County.  Credit 5 days if revoked.   ****AMENDED BY JUDGE BITNEY TO REFLECT THAT DEFENDANT CAN SERVE HIS JAIL TIME ON FOND DULAC COUNTY, OR ANY OTHER COUNTY IN THE STATE OF WISCONSIN, AS LONG AS THE SAME CAN BE DONE WITHOUT COST TO THE TAXPAYERS OF DUNN COUNTY. ***
